et: Middle English, from Old English {it}sibb{/it}, from {it}sibb{/it} kinship; akin to Old High German {it}sippa{/it} kinship, family, Latin {it}sodalis{/it} comrade, Greek {it}ēthos{/it} custom, character, Latin {it}suus{/it} one's own {ma}{mat|suicide|}{/ma}

dt: {bc}a brother or sister considered irrespective of sex
{bc}any plant or animal of a group sharing a degree of genetic relationship corresponding to that of human sibs
{bc}a group of persons unilaterally descended from a real or supposed ancestor

shortdef: a brother or sister considered irrespective of sex; broadly : any plant or animal of a group sharing a degree of genetic relationship corresponding to that of human sibs

dt: town on the Gulf of Oman west of Muscat in northern Oman {it}population{/it} 294,000

shortdef: town on the Gulf of Oman west of Muscat in northern Oman population 294,000
